history.content:
I would say no. It's totally fine. CS170 and EE16B has weekly problem sets, but they should be ok as long as you time manage properly. I'm taking CS161 rn and it is a lot less workload than CS170. R1B is weekly papers (at least it was for me), so that shouldn't be bad. 

Homework wise: expect, for each week, to spend around 3-5 hrs for each problem set, about 3hrs for 161, and probably 3 hrs for R1B.

---------------------

I'd like to add that CS170 weekly problem sets are not as simple as you think and do end up taking a lot of your time (6-12hrs). Add to that, the weekly problem set of EE16B (which will definitely take lesser time than 170 though) and your other commitments, you'll have your hands full.

That being said, if you did the HW option for CS70 in Fall 2016 and kept up with both the CS70 and EE16A problem sets, I think this schedule would be similar. Be advised that CS 161 is definitely more work than CS61A though and R1B workload can vary depending on the class and how good you are in reading/writing.

I would say no. It's totally fine. CS170 and EE16B has weekly problem sets, but they should be ok as long as you time manage properly. I'm taking CS161 rn and it is a lot less workload than CS170. R1B is weekly papers (at least it was for me), so that shouldn't be bad. 

Homework wise: expect, for each week, to spend around 3-5 hrs for each problem set, about 3hrs for 161, and probably 3 hrs for R1B.

children.subject: If you are EECS you cannot P/NP the R1B. :(

This sounds like a lot. 161 has a brutal, ~30 hour project and the weekly problem sets for 16B + 170 will dominate 3-4 days out of every week. The R1B could tip the stress scale so I'd P/NP it if you can.

history.content: Is the above schedule for next semester overkill? I took 61A, EE16A and CS70 in fall 2016, does the workload compare?
history.subject: CS170, EE16B, CS161, R1B
